title: Trump raises tariffs again on China, appears to pause them for others
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he would pause many of his new tariffs for 90 days, even as he raised them further on imports from China.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers will occur at times in Western and Southern provinces and in Puttalam district.

title: Will US trade tariffs impact Sri Lanka’s tourism sector?
byline: Deputy Minister of Tourism Prof. Ruwan Ranasinghe says government does not anticipate the newly imposed US reciprocal tariffs to have a prolonged negative effect on Sri Lanka’s tourism sector.

title: Special security measures in place for Sinhala and Tamil New Year
byline: Sri Lanka Police have launched a comprehensive security operation ahead of the Sinhala and Tamil New Year, aimed at ensuring public safety during the festive season.

title: Trial phase for card payments in expressways begins
byline: The Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation has announced that a pilot project enabling card payments on expressways will be launched this week.

title: Parliament debates ‘Batalanda’ Commission report
byline: The parliamentary debate on the report of the Commission of Inquiry into the alleged establishment and operation of illegal detention centers and torture chambers in the ‘Batalanda’ Housing Scheme is scheduled to begin today (10).

title: Vasavilan-Palaly road reopens after 34 years
byline: The Vasavilan–Palaly road, which remained closed for 34 years due to the prolonged civil conflict, has officially been reopened to the public this morning (10).

title: 30 accident-related deaths reported daily in Sri Lanka: Health Min.
byline: Around 30 to 35 deaths linked to accidents are being reported daily, according to the Ministry of Health.

title: Chennai-Sri Lanka direct train: 60 years later, can Pamban Bridge bring a lost route back?
byline: Decades ago, passengers could travel from Chennai (then Madras) to Colombo, Sri Lanka, by train and ferry. The journey began at Egmore station and continued along the eastern coast, crossing the iconic Pamban Bridge to reach Rameswaram.

title: Separate salary structure for Sri Lanka Police in progress - Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala says that plans are underway to introduce a separate salary structure for Sri Lanka Police.

title: Sri Lanka anticipates operationalization of BIMSTEC Technology Transfer Facility in Colombo - PM
byline: The 6th Summit of the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC), along with the 20th Ministerial Meeting and the 25th Senior Officials Meeting, was held from 02nd to 04th April 2025 in Bangkok...

title: Will April 15 be declared a public holiday?
byline: Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government, Prof. Chandana Abeyratne, informed Parliament today (10) that no final decision has been made regarding the declaration of April 15 as a public holiday.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon brought to court
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, who is currently in remand custody, was brought to the Matara Magistrate’s Court once again today (10).

title: Court orders to re-accept 35 more rejected LG Polls nominations
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered the relevant Returning Officers to reaccept several rejected nomination papers due to issues arising from the certification of birth certificates by Justices of the Peace and the oath taken under the 7th Schedule to the Constitution.

title: Govt committed to ensuring justice for enforced disappearances – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the government is committed to ensuring justice for the victims affected by the injustices related to enforced disappearances.

title: Australia turns down China’s offer to ‘join hands’ to fight US tariffs
byline: Australia on Thursday declined Beijing’s proposal to work together to counter U.S. tariffs, saying instead it would continue to diversify its trade and lower its reliance on China, its largest trading partner.

title: Party leaders’ meeting to discuss US tariff impact begins
byline: The meeting of political party leaders to discuss the impact of US trade tariffs on Sri Lanka has commenced at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo, headed by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, a short while ago.

title: Election-related complaints climb ahead of 2025 LG Polls
byline: A total of 128 complaints have been received regarding violations of election laws and criminal acts related to the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election, according to Police.

title: LeBron James becomes first male athlete with a Ken doll
byline: LeBron James, one of the most iconic figures in modern sports, has made history once again - this time in the toy aisle.

title: Meta whistleblower alleges company worked with China on censorship
byline: A Meta whistleblower told US senators on Wednesday that the company undermined national security in order to build a $18 billion business in China.

title: BOI initiates industry dialogue on reciprocal US tariffs and the way forward
byline: Chairman of the Board of Investment (BOI) Arjuna Hearth has invited all top 50 exporters of the BOI in key industries to open dialogue to seek alternative strategies to mitigate the consequences due to the new US tariff imposed on Sri Lanka.

title: US Dollar climbs above Rs. 300 for first time since September 2024
byline: The Sri Lankan rupee has declined against the US dollar today (10), with the spot exchange rate surpassing the Rs. 300 mark for the first time since September 27, 2024.

title: Death toll nears 200 in Dominican Republic nightclub tragedy
byline: A devastating roof collapse at a popular nightclub in the capital of the Dominican Republic has claimed at least 184 lives, authorities said late on Wednesday, as the search for survivors turned increasingly grim.

title: Pilot project to enable online traffic fine payments
byline: Sri Lanka Police has launched a pilot project to enable motorists to pay traffic fines online, in a move aimed at streamlining the payment process and promoting digital governance.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon granted bail
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon has been granted bail today (10) after being produced before the Matara Magistrate’s Court.

title: Colombo stock market surges after Trump pauses tariffs
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has continued its upward momentum with both key indices making significant gains at the close of regular trading today (10).

title: COPE conducts field investigation at BIA
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) of Parliament, chaired by the Member of Parliament (Dr.) Nishantha Samaraweera, conducted a field investigation at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) on Wednesday (April 09).

title: Sacred Tooth Relic exposition in Kandy: Special notice for devotees
byline: Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, Dr. Hiniduma Sunil Senevi, stated that all necessary arrangements have been made for local and foreign devotees to worship the Sacred Tooth Relic with great pride and proper facilities.

title: Landslide early warnings issued for several areas in 4 districts
byline: The National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for multiple areas in several districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Sri Lanka’s party leaders discuss US tariffs impact, need to diversify export markets
byline: A meeting of party leaders, convened by President Anura Kumara Disanayake, was held today (10) at the Presidential Secretariat to discuss the impact of recent US tariffs on Sri Lanka’s economy and the proposals to discuss the matter with the US government.

title: 22 Indians with expired visas detained in Rajagiriya
byline: Twenty-two Indian nationals with expired visas, employed at an office complex in Rajagiriya, have been detained by immigration officials.

title: Batalanda commission report: Govt vows legal action against Ranil
byline: Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Rathnayake says that legal action will be initiated against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and others held responsible in the ‘Batalanda’ Commission report, potentially with the assistance of international support, if necessary.

title: Beijing bites back at US tariffs by curbing Hollywood imports
byline: China said on Thursday it would immediately restrict imports of Hollywood films in retaliation for President Donald Trump’s escalation of U.S. tariffs on imported Chinese goods, though analysts say the impact is likely to be minimal.

title: EU pauses countermeasures after Trump’s tariff reprieve; US weighing deals
byline: The European Union will pause its first countermeasures against U.S. tariffs after President Donald Trump temporarily lowered the hefty duties less than a day after imposing them on dozens of countries, European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said on Thursday.

title: Trump tariffs on China now stands at 145%, White House confirms
byline: The United States has escalated its tariff war with China, as the White House confirmed Thursday that total US tariffs on Chinese imports now stands at 145 per cent, CNBC reported.
